metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5240 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The DrawDashPolygon function in magick/render.c in GraphicsMagick before 1.3.24 and the SVG renderer in ImageMagick allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) by converting a circularly defined SVG file. It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5240` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1
libgraphicsmagick++3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1
libgraphicsmagick3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1').
